mdRecord.dcterms:title: U.S. Army uniform shirt and tie from World War II
mdRecord.dcterms:description: This shirt and tie was worn by Colonel E. Cato Drash Chief of Surgery of the 8th Evacuation Hospital unit of the U.S. Army during World War II. Khaki colored button down shirt with tie; shirt: plastic buttons, (2) breast pockets, Regulation Military shirt, Form [ ]T, R-112, circular patch on upper left arm: half blue, half grey; tie: Beau Brummell, Garmet mfgd. of U.S.M.C. approved materials, by U.S.M.C. serial 74-4.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Uniforms
World War, 1939-1945
United States. Army. Evacuation Hospital, 8th
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
